name: Drydock Quarter
culture_adjustments: Guild schedules often override tide-ceremony timetables
High transient sailor population weakens strict patrilineal control
Practical literacy concentrated among foremen, quartermasters and augurs
Ancestor rites adapted into workshop/night-watch shrines
constraints: Harbor authority quotas limit new slip construction
Combustion-derived industry restricted by ordinance and safety
notes: Primary maintenance point for state fleet and major merchantmen
Augury houses colocated with chandlers and provisioners
Night-shift rituals maintain watch over slips
